intro: Acmella globosa, commonly known as the globe flower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its spherical, brightly colored flower heads. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy areas, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its flowers are often yellow or orange, with a distinctive globular shape that gives it its common name. Acmella globosa is often used in ornamental gardening due to its vibrant appearance and adaptability to various wetland environments.
